Package net.silthus.schat.chatter

Interface Chatter

All Superinterfaces:
Entity<UUID>, Identified, Identity, MessageTarget, Permissable, Pointered
public sealed interface Chatter extends Entity<UUID>, MessageTarget, Identified, Permissable
The chatter is a message target that can be used to send and receive messages.

Chatters are bound to unique entities (e.g. players or the console) and can join Channels. The chatter instances are cached inside the ChatterRepository and should be retrieved by the Repository.get(Object) method.

Since:
next

    • activeChannel

      Chatter activeChannel(@Nullable @Nullable Channel activeChannel)
      Sets the active channel of the chatter.

      The ChatterChangedActiveChannelEvent is fired if the active channel changed.

      The chatter will automatically join(Channel) the channel.

      Parameters:
      activeChannel - the channel to set active
      Since:
      next

    • isActiveChannel

      default boolean isActiveChannel(@Nullable @Nullable Channel channel)
      Checks if the given channel is the active channel of the chatter.

      This always returns false if the chatter has no active channel.

      Parameters:
      channel - the channel
      Returns:
      true if the channel is active
      Since:
      next

    • join

      void join(@NonNull @NonNull Channel channel)
      Joins the chatter to the given channel ignoring any JoinChannelPolicy.

      Use the JoinChannelCommand to check if the player is allowed to join the channel.

      The ChatterJoinedChannelEvent is fired after the chatter joined the channel.

      Parameters:
      channel - the channel to join
      Since:
      next
      See Also:
      • JoinChannelCommand

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the chatter is a member of the channel
      Since:
      next

    • leave

      void leave(@NonNull @NonNull Channel channel)
      Leaves the given channel ignoring any LeaveChannelPolicy.

      Use the LeaveChannelCommand to check if the player is allowed to leave the channel.

      The ChatterLeftChannelEvent is fired after the chatter left the channel.

      Parameters:
      channel - the channel to leave
      Since:
      next
      See Also:
      • LeaveChannelCommand
